header.title: Cabala Hebræorum: The Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom in Genesis

central_thesis: The foundational principle of this Cabalistic text is that the thirty-two occurrences of the Divine Name 'Elohim' (אלהים) in the first chapter of Genesis correspond to the 'Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom' (Triginta duæ Semitae Sapientiae). These paths represent the fundamental emanations and intelligent principles through which the cosmos was created and is sustained, forming a complete system for spiritual ascent, divine understanding, and practical magical operation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to the Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom
structure_content.summary: The text begins by asserting that the thirty-two paths of wisdom are derived from the thirty-two occurrences of 'Elohim' in Genesis Chapter 1, as interpreted by major Cabalistic authorities. It provides a structured enumeration and description of each path, detailing its unique quality, function, and relationship to the divine emanations and the created world.

structure_content.chapter_title: The First Path: Intelligentia Admirabilis (The Admirable Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path, also called 'Corona Summa' (Supreme Crown), is the primordial light of understanding, without beginning, the first glory. It is an intelligence hidden and occult to all, representing the Aleph, the beginning and head of all, containing all paths universally.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Second Path: Intelligentia Illuminans (The Illuminating Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: Named 'Corona Creationis' (Crown of Creation), this intelligence is the splendor of supreme equality, exalted above all else. It is more known than the first path (Ain Soph) and serves as the origin of all creation, guiding towards equivalence.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Third Path: Intelligentia Sanctificans (The Sanctifying Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path is the 'Basis Sapientiæ Primordialis' (Foundation of Primordial Wisdom), also called 'Artifex Fidei' (Artificer of Faith). Its roots are 'Amen,' the parent of faith, from whose virtue faith emanates. It corresponds to Binah (Intelligence), through which wisdom proceeds into all numerations.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fourth Path: Intelligentia Metalis seu Receptacularis (The Receptacular Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence acts as a vessel, a 'meta,' into which higher intelligences descend. From it emanate all spiritual virtues with subtlety, forming the 'ideal efflux' where one virtue emanates from another in the supreme crown.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fifth Path: Intelligentia Radicatiua (The Radicative Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: Described as the very essence of supreme equality, this intelligence unifies with Binah (Understanding), from which it emanates from the core of primordial wisdom. It is where virtues from higher paths are rooted and become equal before being transferred to lower realms, adapting to diverse human temperaments (mercy or severity).

structure_content.chapter_title: The Sixth Path: Intelligentia Influentiæ Mediantis (The Mediating Intelligence of Influx)
structure_content.summary: This path facilitates the multiplication of emanational influxes, channeling abundant blessings into all the 'pools of blessings' that are unified within it. It is associated with 'waters,' representing divine flow and grace.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Seventh Path: Intelligentia Recondita (The Recondite Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence emits a resplendent light into all intellectual virtues, perceptible to the intellect's eye and through the contemplation of faith. It is called 'recondite' because it is understood through the numerations, distinguishing it from the incomprehensible First Path, and constitutes the substance of intellectual beings.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eighth Path: Intelligentia Perfecta & Absoluta (The Perfect and Absolute Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence represents the 'primordial apparatus' that lacks its own inherent root but inheres in the inner sanctum of Sephirah Magnificence, from whose own essence it emanates. It is known as the 'path of living waters'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Ninth Path: Intelligentia Munda (The Pure Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path purifies the numerations, rectifies and emends the effacement of their images, and organizes their unity, which are united without division or fragmentation. It is termed the 'path of purification of things'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Tenth Path: Intelligentia Resplendens (The Resplendent Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence is exalted above all, residing on the throne of Binah. It illuminates with the splendor of all lights and causes abundant influx to flow to the 'prince of faces.' It is called the 'path of variety of things'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eleventh Path: Intelligentia Fulgida (The Shining Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path is the very essence of the 'ordered curtain' (פרגוד), arranged according to the disposition of the higher and lower paths. It is a given dignity, allowing it to stand before the 'face of the Cause of Causes'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twelfth Path: Intelligentia Claritatis (The Intelligence of Clarity)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence is the 'species of magnificence,' and is called the place from which the vision of seers arises in apparition. Through it, prophecy is acquired, and one reaches the highest chariot.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Thirteenth Path: Intelligentia Inductiva Unitatis (The Inductive Intelligence of Unity)
structure_content.summary: This path constitutes the very substance of glory and perfects the individual spiritual entities of truth. All paths that seek supreme unity arrive at it through this thirteenth path, as 'thirteen' is a significant number.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fourteenth Path: Intelligentia Illuminans (The Illuminating Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence is 'Cheshmal,' the institutor of arcana, the foundation of holiness, and the apparatus of these principles. It is called the 'path of arcana in created, non-existent things'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fifteenth Path: Intelligentia Constitutiva (The Constitutive Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence establishes creation in the 'darkness of the world.' Philosophers identified it as the 'darkness' mentioned in Job 38. It is also called the 'path of the opening of lights'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Sixteenth Path: Intelligentia Triumphans & Æterna (The Triumphant and Eternal Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path embodies the 'delight of glory,' which resembles itself, and is called 'Paradise of Pleasure,' prepared for the pious. It is also referred to as the 'path of victory against evil genii'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Seventeenth Path: Intelligentia Dispositiva (The Dispositive Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence prepares the pious faithful to be clothed in the Holy Spirit. It is called the 'foundation of beauty' in the upper state and presides over all higher and lower forms.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eighteenth Path: Intelligentia sive Domus Affluentiae (The Intelligence, or House of Affluence)
structure_content.summary: From its deep inquiry are drawn arcana and hidden meanings that lie in its shadow, clung to by those who diligently scrutinize its essence from the Cause of Causes.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nineteenth Path: Intelligentia Secreti (The Intelligence of Secrecy)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence concerns the secret of all spiritual operations because it is the 'affluentia' that diffuses from the highest blessing and the most sublime glory. It is the 'path of affluence' into all numerations.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twentieth Path: Intelligentia Voluntatis (The Intelligence of Will)
structure_content.summary: This path is the apparatus of all individual creatures, and through it, the existence of primordial wisdom is made known. It is called the 'path of the arcana of wisdom'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-First Path: Intelligentia Complacentia Quæsiti (The Intelligence of the Complacency of the Sought)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence receives divine influx so that it may flow forth with blessing into all existing things, acting as a 'fountain' or 'pool'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Second Path: Intelligentia Fidelis (The Faithful Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: Into its hand are entrusted spiritual virtues, fostered by it so that they may be close to those who dwell under its shadow.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Third Path: Intelligentia Stabilita (The Stabilized Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence represents the virtue of 'perseverance' for all the numerations (Sephiroth), providing stability and continuity to the divine structure.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Fourth Path: Intelligentia Imaginativa (The Imaginative Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence bestows form upon all the created images, providing the conceptual templates for manifestation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Fifth Path: Intelligentia Tentativa (The Tentative Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path represents the 'primary test' (נסיוני) through which the Creator tests all the pious, acting as a crucible for spiritual refinement.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Sixth Path: Intelligentia Renouans (The Renewing Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: Through this intelligence, all things that were renewed in the creation of the world are renewed again, signifying continuous regeneration and innovation within the cosmos.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Seventh Path: Intelligentia Concitatiua (The Moving Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence is the fundamental 'matter' from which all created things beneath the supernal sphere originate, as well as their motions and sensations.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Eighth Path: Intelligentia Naturalis (The Natural Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: Through this intelligence, the nature of all existing things beneath the sphere of the sun is brought to perfection, completing their natural essence.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Twenty-Ninth Path: Intelligentia Corporalis (The Corporeal Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence forms every body that is corporified under the apparatus of all spheres and governs their growth and increment.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Thirtieth Path: Intelligentia Collectiva (The Collective Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This path encompasses the judgments of the heavens, stars, and constellations, and the perfections of scientific knowledge according to the revolutions of their spheres, representing cosmic order.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Thirty-First Path: Intelligentia Collectiva Pariter (The Equally Collective Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This intelligence comprehends all the virtues of the spheres, signs, forms, and their judgments or ratios, providing a holistic understanding of celestial influences.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Thirty-Second Path: Intelligentia Adminicularis (The Auxiliary Intelligence)
structure_content.summary: This final path directs and concurs with all the operations of the seven planets and their various parts, signifying the guiding hand in the manifestation of celestial influences on the mundane plane.

key_concepts.term: Triginta duæ Semitae Sapientiae (Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom)
key_concepts.definition: The core Cabalistic system outlined, comprising the 10 Sephiroth and the 22 paths connecting them, all derived from the 32 occurrences of 'Elohim' in Genesis Chapter 1. These paths represent divine emanations and principles of creation.

A divine name used in the Hebrew Bible, specifically in Genesis 1. Its 32 occurrences are considered by Cabalists to be the linguistic and numerical foundation for the Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom, symbolizing the divine creative force manifest in the cosmos.
The ten divine emanations or attributes, part of the 32 Paths, through which God continuously reveals Himself and creates the universe. The text refers to them as 'numerationes' or 'Sephiræ'.

The Sephirah of Understanding or Intelligence. It is frequently mentioned as a pivotal point, either as the source from which wisdom flows into other numerations, or as a residence for certain paths, indicating its role in the intellectual apprehension of divine principles.

The 'Infinite' or 'Without End,' referring to the unknowable, ultimate divine essence prior to any emanation. The First Path is described as preceding the 'Ain Soph,' emphasizing its profound hiddenness.
A name for the First Path, signifying its primordial, unbegun nature and its supreme position as the initial point of divine manifestation and understanding, akin to Kether.

key_concepts.term: Nomen quadraginta duarum literarum (Name of forty-two letters)
key_concepts.definition: A powerful divine name, often associated with the Name of God, used in practical Qabalah for enhanced efficacy in prayer and ritual, believed to derive from specific verses of the Torah.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a practical system for spiritual investigation, divine communion, and the acquisition of prophetic and magical abilities. It proposes that by meditating upon and understanding the 'Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom' derived from Genesis 1, a practitioner can attune themselves to the divine influx (lumen) and unravel the mysteries of creation. The methodology involves a rigorous internal and external preparation to facilitate direct apprehension of these intelligent principles.
tools: The thirty-two occurrences of 'Elohim' in Genesis Chapter 1, which are the textual keys to the paths.
The Divine Name 'Elohim' (אלחים) itself, used in prayer and invocation.
The Name of Forty-Two Letters ('nomen quadraginta duarum literarum'), employed for greater efficacy in petitions.
Internal purity: 'clean heart' (corde mundo), 'unwavering faith' (fide inconcussa), and 'ardent charity' (charitate ardenti) as prerequisites for successful operation.
rituals: Intense study and preparation ('summo studio & praeparatione praenixa') of the thirty-two places in Genesis 1 corresponding to the paths.
Specific prayers ('certis orationibus adhibitis') directed towards God (אלחים) to request enlightenment regarding a particular path.
Various ceremonies ('variisque adhibitis cærimonijs') to aid in the invocation and apprehension of the desired intelligence.

relevant_quotes.text: Loca in quibus Nomen Dei אלהים trigeſies bis in primo Genesis capite ponitur.
Atque hæ funt triginta duæ ſemitz, quas ex capite primo Genefis eruunt רבי שמעין בן ירחאי Rasbi, R. Iofeph Haaruch, ijtque tingulis fua nomina ab effectibus deducta, imponunt Hageonun.

Prima femita vocatur Intelligentia admirabilis, Corona summa. Est enim lumen dans intelligere primordium fine principio, & est gloria prima; nulla creatura valet assequi existentiam eius. id est, intelligentia abscondita, occulta omnibus, quæ extra eam funt, Aleph, principium & caput omnium; eft siquidem forma omnium literarum, & omnes semitæ in ea sunt, sed per modum uniuersalem.

Usus harum semitarum practicus hic est. Cabalistae cum Deum per certam aliquam naturalium rerum semitam inuestigare volunt; primò summo studio & praeparatione praenixa, triginta duo loca primi capitis Geneseos, hoc est, semitas rerum creatarum consulunt; deinde certis orationibus adhibitis per nomen אלחים Deum obtestantur, vt lumen propositæ semitz inuestigandæ congruum largiatur, variisque adhibitis cærimonijs tandem sibi persuadent, intelligentiæ se lumen adeptos, dummodo corde mundo, fide inconcussa, & charitate ardenti inquifitioni institerint.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is profoundly relevant to Western Esotericism and Qabalah as it articulates the foundational concept of the Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom. These paths form the blueprint for the Tree of Life, providing a comprehensive framework for understanding divine emanations, cosmogenesis, and the spiritual anatomy of existence. Its detailed exegesis of Genesis 1 through the lens of 'Elohim' occurrences links textual mysticism with operative Cabala, demonstrating how sacred texts are seen as living maps for spiritual exploration. It provides a historical context for the interpretation of Sephiroth and paths, influencing later Hermetic Qabalah traditions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes advanced students and practitioners of Qabalah, Hermeticists, occultists engaged in ritual magic and contemplative practices, and scholars of Jewish mysticism and comparative esotericism. It is particularly valuable for those seeking to deepen their understanding of the Tree of Life as a living, dynamic system rather than a static diagram.
